text:
Hey <@U01QVR44MEY>, here i come again with the same issue. Okay let me clear with the exact issue now.
When i go with this payload :
```{
    "access": "PUBLIC_INDEXABLE",
    "name": "test.jpg",
    "url": "<https://sample-videos.com/img/Sample-jpg-image-50kb.jpg>",
    "folderId": "119046473520",
    "duplicateValidationStrategy": "REJECT",
    "duplicateValidationScope": "EXACT_FOLDER",
    "overwrite": true
}```
it still let me duplicate the file 1 time. First time it uploads `test.jpeg` and second time uploads the same file by adding the extension jpeg one more time like `test.jpeg.jpeg` . Please look at the screenshot:

It is my usecase I have to use `folderId` instead `folderPath` and it is not working fine on HubSpot's end.
Please run the same case on your side.
this is the response of file status API. That screenshot will make you more clear about the issue:

Hello <@U058ZPH175H> Thanks for your reply.
But with your method, if a value of the property is associated to an object once I update the property I will loose this association right?

Yeah with the API it is possible to end up deleting enum options that are in use.

When trying to delete an enum option via the Settings UI, the delete button would be greyed out and this message would be shown on hover:
```You can't delete options that are in use. You're using one or more of these <your_field_name> options. Remove them from these places first, or merge them with other options.```
But with the API these guards will not be in place.
And you could potentially end up with some records having invalid values on them (values that are not part of the current enumeration)

As long as you are only adding new enum options like you mentioned in the first message in the thread, this should not be a problem <@U049WTE7AEB>
I see, thanks
I will made some tests

Hey all, has anyone here had success connecting *Looker* to HubSpot using Looker’s native scheduled data send? It only requires an API key connector on the Looker side, so it’s not a middleware integration or an installed marketplace app. Looker seems to be reaching the batch update endpoint for either contacts or companies, and the Looker logs are not showing any errors on the API response, but in HS it shows 0 calls made to the private app key. Has anyone here used this Looker connector to send data to HS using the scheduled send tool? Any help is greatly appreciated!

Hello, peeps! *HELP*! I’m in discovery to retrieve all engagement sales emails sent (and thread/replies to this email) and associated with a specific deal, so far I am able to:

• :white_check_mark: retrieve all emails ids associated with a specific deal id
• :white_check_mark: retrieve content details from the emails ids associated with that deal id
Now my challenge is:
• :exploding_head: *how to retrieve the email thread created when a customer replies to that sales email?* 
I need to be able to retrieve the content from the customer replies to that sales email.
In HubSpot UI, I see the thread is created and when inspecting the code, I can see that there is a `data-thread-title-id` in the UI code, but I can’t find in any documentation or forum how to retrieve the customer reply aka thread.

Has anyone here done it before or knows how to achieve it? Thanks in advance :sweat_smile:
You can use the Engagement API: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview>
Whata about using the Engagements API? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview>
<@U01B05EPYCX>, ?. This conversation was from 5 months ago, we solved it
<@U01B05EPYCX>, why do you keep talking about the engagements api in old conversations? the engagements api was already brought up in this conversation
I already told him about the engagements api (see the conversation), and also why are you using the docs from the legacy docs
<@U03BA1PRV7S> she did the same thing in another conversation, from 5 months ago
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1686150258064529?thread_ts=1671104604.523769&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face:
Looking at this post <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/HubDB-limit-for-10000-records-per-table/m-p/354821> and solution <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/hubdb/join-multiple-tables>, is there a limitated number of foreign keys which can be stored in the foreign key field ? Thanks

Hi everyone!
Is there a way to access the additional emails of a contact via API?

(Additional emails are inside the Email Property of the Contact Object, see the photo as a guidance)
Because I searched for it around activities api and couldn’t find anything here, so I figured someone would be searching like me and I wanted to share what I found :slightly_smiling_face:
Interesting, but you did notice that <@U03BA1PRV7S> did share the engagements api right?
Specifically related to tasks yes; but the broader ask for all engagements
ok
Because it had a great diagram for my developer to use showing the relationships of activities to companies and explanation of the overall activities included in engagements
I personally don't see any diagram...

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm>

This might be better to share if you're just info dumping
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/engagements>
(has all the new engagement types with the updated structure, also works with the SDK and those endpoints so that's a plus)
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1686156265790819?thread_ts=1671104604.523769&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
That is super helpful <@U01QVR44MEY> trying to explain HubSpot to a general dev vs. a HubSpot dev!  :heart: :pray:
of course, no problem. Love that you were trying to backtrack and post some things for future people just was a little confused about why
Also wanted to make sure you knew that those were the legacy endpoint and they don't have all the super fancy functionality of the new ones that you might want to be using
what's the best way to explore the possible methods available to me with this HubSpot client? <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs>
I am trying to add a just created contact to an existing list
but it's unclear how to figure out which methods to use
Do you want to read or write?
Writing is done through the secondary email api: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/add-a-secondary-email-address>
reading is done through the hs_additional_emails property
Thanks Carter!
of course, NP!
You can see which method to use in the docs, for that particular endpoint:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/add_contact_to_list>
This is definitely an <@U6W3H6YN8> question, he's the master

<@U01QVR44MEY> so would it be something like
```await HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.v1.lists.list_id.add()?```
list_id is probably not used like that (but I'm not all that sure how it would be used)
oh I really don't know I thought you were talking about using the .apiRequest in the SDK. I really hate using the SDK
For this exact reason
damn, if you don't use it there's no hope!
lol
Yeah bro Axios is the way
the only way
I'm fine making the regular request (like my above example)
like that
understood, yeah the SDK is a pain and a half
always doing things I don't want it to do
never know which endpoints it will use
I thought there is some way of exploring the API in a way that makes sense
yeah there is but that's only for the endpoint urls
I started digging into the code (that feels like the only way)
the SDK methods are undocumented
lol
Yep I have dug through that code for 20+ hours at this point
And I'm a fairly advanced nodejs programmer
I'm a novice but can do a lot by accident :laughing:
metoo
I'm also going to try adding an extension that helps dig into the API
I get some code completion but I assume there's a better way
Yeah the openapi specs are a great way
but those don't tell you how to use the SDK
Honestly bro I would just abandon the SDK
damn
not sure why that's a bummer but it is
<@U7SL518D6> any advice?
ah you summoned a wizard
woah
I'm 84% sure Jon built a lot of the documentation and knows all the things

Hi everyone, I have been developing a custom CRM card using the HubSpot API, and I am currently facing a challenge in adding a dropdown field to the card. any guidance?
I've never developed a custom CRM card and I'm not sure I can help but where are you running into trouble? How far along are you?
this is interesting but out of date: <https://HubSpotwebteam.github.io/hs-node-api/hs_contacts.html>
I developed all the aspects but I want to show a drop-down from the data that I have in the card , for example list of contact role, but there isn't any field type for that.
Heyo. I may not be able to get you an answer tonight but, question are you using the API client in a serverless function or somewhere else?
hey, in a serverless function yea

Okay. Heads up. And this is unfortunate the version of the API client in HubSpot cms serverless is outdated. So if you're  trying to use that to hit an API not supported or has changed since that api client version you could have issues. I recommend using axios to make the post request directly
haha
this is the way
gotcha, thank you both
I'm looking but is there an example of using axios with a private app around somewhere?
<@UDHT6N5SM> technically you could use webpack or the dependencies beta (I think you're in that one) to get the updated package but honestly probably not worth the hassle
<@U01QVR44MEY> do you mean to add axios?
no axios is already in by default, I mean add the updated HubSpot sdk
ah
can I authenticate using a private app if I am posting to a v1 API (lists?)
looks like yes...debugging...
this is working now I think
hopefully a long delay when adding to lists...
all good now!

Hey everyone,
I'm running into some issues with the Tasks api endpoints and I'm hoping someone on could help me answer a couple questions. I need to search through tasks by subject and pull the ids for the tasks that match a specific task subject name. I need to do it using the API, however the search endpoint for tasks (/crm/v3/objects/tasks/search) is a post request and I'm not sure why. Can you help me understand two things:
1) What is being posted when you search for tasks via the task search endpoint?
2) How can I get the api to return the ID's of the specific tasks I'm searching for?

Thanks so much!
Also interesting note, its the only endpoint in tasks where the scopes are "read" despite being a post request

Hey everyone,

I am using -API Path
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>
Response:
{
            "id": "1",
            "properties": {

                "email": "<mailto:emailmaria@HubSpot.com|emailmaria@HubSpot.com>",
                "firstname": "Maria",

            },
            "createdAt": "2022-10-18T15:30:32.286Z",
            "updatedAt": "2023-04-05T13:10:01.809Z",
